00010 #if !defined(GEOGRAPHICLIB_LOCALCARTESIAN_HPP)
00011 #define GEOGRAPHICLIB_LOCALCARTESIAN_HPP "$Id: f9346d8010f4b5b4e74a65961b472c73578dfbfe $"
00012 
00013 #include <GeographicLib/Geocentric.hpp>
00014 #include <GeographicLib/Constants.hpp>
00015 
00016 namespace GeographicLib {
00017 
00018   /**
00019    * \brief Local Cartesian coordinates
00020    *
00021    * Convert between geodetic coordinates latitude = \e lat, longitude = \e
00022    * lon, height = \e h (measured vertically from the surface of the ellipsoid)
00023    * to local cartesian coordinates (\e x, \e y, \e z).  The origin of local
00024    * cartesian coordinate system is at \e lat = \e lat0, \e lon = \e lon0, \e h
00025    * = \e h0. The \e z axis is normal to the ellipsoid; the \e y axis points
00026    * due north.  The plane \e z = - \e h0 is tangent to the ellipsoid.
00027    *
00028    * The conversions all take place via geocentric coordinates using a
00029    * Geocentric object (by default Geocentric::WGS84).
00030    **********************************************************************/
00031 
00032   class GEOGRAPHIC_EXPORT LocalCartesian {
00033   private:
00034     typedef Math::real real;
00035     static const size_t dim_ = 3;
00036     static const size_t dim2_ = dim_ * dim_;
00037     const Geocentric _earth;
00038     real _lat0, _lon0, _h0;
00039     real _x0, _y0, _z0, _r[dim2_];
00040     void IntForward(real lat, real lon, real h, real& x, real& y, real& z,
00041                     real M[dim2_]) const throw();
00042     void IntReverse(real x, real y, real z, real& lat, real& lon, real& h,
00043                     real M[dim2_]) const throw();
00044     void MatrixMultiply(real M[dim2_]) const throw();
00045   public:
00046 
00047     /**
00048      * Constructor setting the origin.
00049      *
00050      * @param[in] lat0 latitude at origin (degrees).
00051      * @param[in] lon0 longitude at origin (degrees).
00052      * @param[in] h0 height above ellipsoid at origin (meters); default 0.
00053      * @param[in] earth Geocentric object for the transformation; default
00054      *   Geocentric::WGS84.
00055      **********************************************************************/
00056     LocalCartesian(real lat0, real lon0, real h0 = 0,
00057                    const Geocentric& earth = Geocentric::WGS84) throw()
00058       : _earth(earth)
00059     { Reset(lat0, lon0, h0); }
00060 
00061     /**
00062      * Default constructor.
00063      *
00064      * @param[in] earth Geocentric object for the transformation; default
00065      *   Geocentric::WGS84.
00066      *
00067      * Sets \e lat0 = 0, \e lon0 = 0, \e h0 = 0.
00068      **********************************************************************/
00069     explicit LocalCartesian(const Geocentric& earth = Geocentric::WGS84)
00070       throw()
00071       : _earth(earth)
00072     { Reset(real(0), real(0), real(0)); }
00073 
00074     /**
00075      * Reset the origin.
00076      *
00077      * @param[in] lat0 latitude at origin (degrees).
00078      * @param[in] lon0 longitude at origin (degrees).
00079      * @param[in] h0 height above ellipsoid at origin (meters); default 0.
00080      **********************************************************************/
00081     void Reset(real lat0, real lon0, real h0 = 0)
00082       throw();
00083 
00084     /**
00085      * Convert from geodetic to local cartesian coordinates.
00086      *
00087      * @param[in] lat latitude of point (degrees).
00088      * @param[in] lon longitude of point (degrees).
00089      * @param[in] h height of point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00090      * @param[out] x local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00091      * @param[out] y local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00092      * @param[out] z local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00093      *
00094      * \e lat should be in the range [-90, 90]; \e lon and \e lon0 should be in
00095      * the range [-180, 360].
00096      **********************************************************************/
00097     void Forward(real lat, real lon, real h, real& x, real& y, real& z)
00098       const throw() {
00099       IntForward(lat, lon, h, x, y, z, NULL);
00100     }
00101 
00102     /**
00103      * Convert from geodetic to local cartesian coordinates and return rotation
00104      * matrix.
00105      *
00106      * @param[in] lat latitude of point (degrees).
00107      * @param[in] lon longitude of point (degrees).
00108      * @param[in] h height of point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00109      * @param[out] x local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00110      * @param[out] y local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00111      * @param[out] z local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00112      * @param[out] M if the length of the vector is 9, fill with the rotation
00113      *   matrix in row-major order.
00114      *
00115      * Pre-multiplying a unit vector in local cartesian coordinates at (lat,
00116      * lon, h) by \e M transforms the vector to local cartesian coordinates at
00117      * (lat0, lon0, h0).
00118      **********************************************************************/
00119     void Forward(real lat, real lon, real h, real& x, real& y, real& z,
00120                  std::vector<real>& M)
00121       const throw()  {
00122       real t[dim2_];
00123       IntForward(lat, lon, h, x, y, z, t);
00124       if (M.end() == M.begin() + dim2_)
00125         copy(t, t + dim2_, M.begin());
00126     }
00127 
00128     /**
00129      * Convert from local cartesian to geodetic coordinates.
00130      *
00131      * @param[in] x local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00132      * @param[in] y local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00133      * @param[in] z local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00134      * @param[out] lat latitude of point (degrees).
00135      * @param[out] lon longitude of point (degrees).
00136      * @param[out] h height of point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00137      *
00138      * The value of \e lon returned is in the range [-180, 180).
00139      **********************************************************************/
00140     void Reverse(real x, real y, real z, real& lat, real& lon, real& h)
00141       const throw() {
00142       IntReverse(x, y, z, lat, lon, h, NULL);
00143     }
00144 
00145     /**
00146      * Convert from local cartesian to geodetic coordinates and return rotation
00147      * matrix.
00148      *
00149      * @param[in] x local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00150      * @param[in] y local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00151      * @param[in] z local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00152      * @param[out] lat latitude of point (degrees).
00153      * @param[out] lon longitude of point (degrees).
00154      * @param[out] h height of point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00155      * @param[out] M if the length of the vector is 9, fill with the rotation
00156      *   matrix in row-major order.
00157      *
00158      * Pre-multiplying a unit vector in local cartesian coordinates at (lat0,
00159      * lon0, h0) by the transpose of \e M transforms the vector to local
00160      * cartesian coordinates at (lat, lon, h).
00161      **********************************************************************/
00162     void Reverse(real x, real y, real z, real& lat, real& lon, real& h,
00163                  std::vector<real>& M)
00164       const throw() {
00165       real t[dim2_];
00166       IntReverse(x, y, z, lat, lon, h, t);
00167       if (M.end() == M.begin() + dim2_)
00168         copy(t, t + dim2_, M.begin());
00169     }
00170 
00171     /** \name Inspector functions
00172      **********************************************************************/
00173     ///@{
00174     /**
00175      * @return latitude of the origin (degrees).
00176      **********************************************************************/
00177     Math::real LatitudeOrigin() const throw() { return _lat0; }
00178 
00179     /**
00180      * @return longitude of the origin (degrees).
00181      **********************************************************************/
00182     Math::real LongitudeOrigin() const throw() { return _lon0; }
00183 
00184     /**
00185      * @return height of the origin (meters).
00186      **********************************************************************/
00187     Math::real HeightOrigin() const throw() { return _h0; }
00188 
00189     /**
00190      * @return \e a the equatorial radius of the ellipsoid (meters).  This is
00191      *   the value of \e a inherited from the Geocentric object used in the
00192      *   constructor.
00193      **********************************************************************/
00194     Math::real MajorRadius() const throw() { return _earth.MajorRadius(); }
00195 
00196     /**
00197      * @return \e r the inverse flattening of the ellipsoid.  This is the
00198      *   value of \e r inherited from the Geocentric object used in the
00199      *   constructor.  A value of 0 is returned for a sphere (infinite inverse
00200      *   flattening).
00201      **********************************************************************/
00202     Math::real InverseFlattening() const throw()
00203     { return _earth.InverseFlattening(); }
00204     ///@}
00205   };
00206 
00207 } // namespace GeographicLib
